info.author: whatap
info.description:
.. image:: https://login.whatap.io/static/whatap_logo.png

.. _WhaTap: https://www.whatap.io/

WhaTap_ for python
==================

- Whatap allows for application performance monitoring.
- Support: WSGI server application & Batch job & Specific method
- Python version : 2.7 + & 3.3+

Installation
------------

  .. code:: bash

    $ pip install whatap-python

Application Monitoring
----------------------

supported Django, Flask, Bottle, Cherrypy, Tornado and WSGI Server Application.

Configuration
~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Set configuration.

  .. code:: bash

    $ export WHATAP_HOME=[application_path]
    $ whatap-config-license [license_key]
    $ whatap-config-host [host_addr]
    $ whatap-config-app-name [xxxx]
    $ whatap-config-app-process-name [xxxx]

Usage
~~~~~

Include the following imports at the top of every module.

  .. code:: python

    import whatap
    whatap.agent()

    ...

If you want WSGI Application monitoring, include the @register_app decorator.

  .. code:: python

    import whatap

    @whatap.register_app
    def simple_app(environ, start_response):
    """Simplest possible application object"""
        status = '200 OK'
        response_headers = [('Content-type', 'text/plain')]
        start_response(status, response_headers)
        return ['Hello world!\n']

If you want method profiling, include the @method_profiling decorator.

  .. code:: python

    from whatap import method_profiling

    @method_profiling
    def db_connection():
        db.connect('mysql:// ..')

    @method_profiling
    def query():
        db.select('select * from ..')

      ....

Batch Monitoring
----------------

for Batch job.

Configuration
~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Set Environment valiable configuration.

  .. code:: bash

    $ export WHATAP_BATCH_HOME=[batch_file_dir]


Usage
~~~~~

Include the following imports at the top of every module.

  .. code:: python

    import whatap
    whatap.agent()

    ...

You make configuration file.

  .. code:: bash

    $ cat >> $WHATAP_BATCH_HOME/whatap.conf << EOF
    license=[license_key]
    whatap.server.host=[host_addr]

    app_name=batch
    app_process_name=batch
    EOF

Start bach agent.

  .. code:: bash

    $ whatap-start-batch

Example code.

  .. code:: python

    from whatap import method_profiling

    class Command(BaseCommand):

        @batch_profiling
        def handle(self, *args, **options):
            // batch code..
            ....

Restart
-------

Your Application restart.
